{"abstract": "Mr. Tillerson, Exxon Mobil\u2019s chief executive and a secretary of state candidate, has a relationship with Russia that could be both a strength and his Achilles\u2019 heel.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/11/business/rex-tillerson-secretary-of-state-russia.html", "snippet": "Mr. Tillerson, Exxon Mobil\u2019s chief executive and a secretary of state candidate, has a relationship with Russia that could be both a strength and his Achilles\u2019 heel.", "lead_paragraph": "HOUSTON \u2014 Twenty years ago, as Rex W. Tillerson was rising through the ranks at Exxon, he was charged with negotiating with the government of Yemen to build a natural gas export plant. {"abstract": "The energy giant\u2019s days as Big Oil\u2019s unparalleled heavyweight are numbered, as rivals are coming up fast.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/13/business/dealbook/exxons-next-chief-will-lead-a-weakened-empire.html", "snippet": "The energy giant\u2019s days as Big Oil\u2019s unparalleled heavyweight are numbered, as rivals are coming up fast.", "lead_paragraph": "Exxon Mobil\u2019s next chief executive will confront a weakened empire in 2017. {"abstract": "A tax provision allows incoming executive branch members to defer capital gains taxes on any divestments required under ethics rules.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/14/business/dealbook/for-trumps-wealthy-cabinet-prospect-of-a-sweet-tax-break.html", "snippet": "A tax provision allows incoming executive branch members to defer capital gains taxes on any divestments required under ethics rules.", "lead_paragraph": "There are many dewy-eyed reasons a wealthy and powerful business executive would choose to give up a throne in the private sector and move to Washington for an important government job. There is the chance to give something back to your country through public service, the belief that you have some serious expertise to offer the incoming president and his administration, and a feeling that the country has been on the wrong course and that every American could benefit from some new thinking. Plus, when you get asked to serve the president of the United States, well, you do it.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "For Trump\u2019s Wealthy Cabinet, Prospect of a Sweet Tax Break", "kicker": "Street Scene", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Federal Taxes (US)", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "United States Politics and Government", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Cohn, Gary D", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Mnuchin, Steven T", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Paulson, Henry M Jr", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Ross, Wilbur L Jr", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Trump, Donald J", "rank": 7, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Tillerson, Rex W", "rank": 8, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Goldman Sachs Group Inc", "rank": 9, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Exxon Mobil Corp", "rank": 10, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2016-12-14T21:17:23+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By William D.
